snippet: Under the new rules, intended to streamline a process long criticized as too cumbersome, only one judgment, instead of two, will be required.
abstract: Pope Francis will institute new measures in December 2015 to simplify process of annulling a marriage; church officials acknowledge that current process is disadvantageous to poor, but are clear in an insistence that church doctrine concerning marriage remains unchanged.

byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
byline.contributor: Jim Yardley reported from Vatican City, and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome. Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Vatican City, and Laurie Goodstein from New York.

lead_paragraph: Under the new rules, intended to streamline a process long criticized as too cumbersome, only one judgment, instead of two, will be required.

headline.main: Pope Francis Announces Changes for Easier Marriage Annulments
headline.print_headline: Vatican Announces Changes to Make Marriage Annulments Easier
